H0.text: Earth rotating on its axis causes the appearance of the Moon to change as seen from Earth throughout the month.

H1.text: The Moon rotating on its axis causes the appearance of the Moon to change as seen from Earth throughout the month.

H2.text: Earth revolving around the Sun causes the appearance of the Moon to change as seen from Earth throughout the month.

H3.text: The Moon revolving around Earth causes the appearance of the Moon to change as seen from Earth throughout the month.

A4.text: The Moon's elongation varies from 0° at new moon to 180° at full moon, which is due to its orbital motion around Earth.

A5.text: The synodic month is longer than the sidereal month because Earth's orbital motion around the Sun affects the alignment of Earth, Moon, and Sun.

A7.text: The Moon's appearance depends on the position of the Moon with respect to the Sun as seen from Earth.
